benchmark_details.name: VLRMBench: A Comprehensive and Challenging Benchmark for Vision-Language Reward Models
benchmark_details.overview: VLRMBench is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate Vision-Language Reward Models (VLRMs) across various aspects of reasoning, judgement and critique generation, encompassing a total of 12,634 questions divided into 12 distinct tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized evaluation platform for Vision-Language Reward Models (VLRMs) to further their development and improve multimodal reasoning capabilities.

data.source: Constructed from a combination of three distinct categories of datasets focusing on mathematical reasoning, hallucination understanding, and multi-image understanding.
data.annotation: High-quality samples curated through a collaborative data filtering and generation pipeline.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using evaluation prompts designed for each task based on the performance of the models.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted through the weighted average of scores across tasks indicating the relative effectiveness of models.
methodology.baseline_results: Models such as GPT-4o and Claude-3.5-Sonnet are used as baseline indicators for performance in evaluation.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted on 21 open-source models and 5 closed-source models provide validation for the benchmark.
